Sentencas: Generalized predictive control (GPC) is applied to control the maximum temperature in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack and the temperature difference over the stack.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: GPC is a model predictive control method and the models utilized in this work are ARX-type (autoregressive with extra input), multiple input-multiple output, polynomial models that were identified from experimental data obtained from experiments with a complete SOFC system.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: The proposed control is evaluated by simulation with various input-output combinations, with and without constraints.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: A comparison with conventional proportional-integral-derivative (PID) control is also made.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: It is shown that if only the stack maximum temperature is controlled, a standard PID controller can be used to obtain output performance comparable to that obtained with the significantly more complex model predictive controller.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: However, in order to control the temperature difference over the stack, both the stack minimum and the maximum temperature need to be controlled and this cannot be done with a single PID controller.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data

Sentencas: In such a case the model predictive controller provides a feasible and effective solution.
Titulo: Model predictive control of the solid oxide fuel cell stack temperature with models based on experimental data
